Session-2



1. take array of list apply leaner search.


package Pack3;

import java.util.Scanner;

public class LinearSearch {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub

		int arr[]=new int[5];
		int key;
		
		Scanner sc=new Scanner(System.in);
		
		System.out.println("Enter Array Elements:");
		for(int i=0;i<arr.length;i++)
		{
		arr[i]=sc.nextInt();	
		}
		
		System.out.println("\nEnter Key:");
		key=sc.nextInt();
		int j;
		for(j=0;j<arr.length;j++)
		{
			if(arr[j]==key)
			{
				System.out.println("Key Found at Location "+j);
				break;
			}
			
			
		}
		if(j==arr.length)
		{s
			System.out.println("Element is not found");
		}
	}

}




2. Take array soreted apply binary search.


package PracticeSet;

import java.util.Scanner;
public class BinaryEx {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
	
		int arr[]=new int[5];
		int mid,f=0,l=arr.length-1;
		Scanner sc=new Scanner(System.in);
		int key;
		
		System.out.println("Enter Array Elements:");
		for(int i=0;i<arr.length;i++)
		{
			arr[i]=sc.nextInt();
		}
		
		System.out.println("Enter Key:");
		key=sc.nextInt();
		
		mid=(f+l)/2;

		/*for(int a:arr)
		{
			System.out.print(a+" ");
		}
		*/
		
		while(mid>=0 && mid<arr.length)
		{
		if(arr[mid]==key)
		{
			System.out.println("value find at "+mid+" Position");
			break;
		}
		
		else if(key>arr[mid])
		{
			mid=mid+1;
			
		}
		
		else if(key<arr[mid])
		{
			mid=mid-1;
		}
	}
		if(mid<0 || mid>=arr.length)
		{
			System.out.println("Key not found");
		}
	}

}
